name: Totokia
description: A traditional Fijian club with a pineapple-shaped head used in close combat. Symbolizes power and precision.

name: Nifo Oti
description: A Samoan weapon embedded with shark teeth, designed for slicing and slashing in battle.

name: Ula Throwing Club
description: A short, round-headed throwing club used by Fijian warriors to disable opponents from a distance.

name: Taiaha
description: A long-handled Māori weapon used for striking and stabbing, rich with ceremonial significance.

name: Wahaika
description: A ceremonial Māori weapon often worn by chiefs, carved with ancestral designs.

name: Papuan Bone Dagger
description: A dagger traditionally carved from bone and worn as part of ceremonial attire in highland Papua.

name: Tongan War Paddle
description: A dual-purpose paddle and striking weapon, often decorated with geometric motifs.

name: Hawaiian Shark Tooth Club
description: Used in hand-to-hand combat, these clubs feature embedded shark teeth for maximum impact.

name: Ceremonial Paddle of Rarotonga
description: Elaborately carved paddle used in sacred rituals and processions in the Cook Islands.

name: War Shield of the Highlands
description: A large oval shield painted with symbolic patterns, used by highland tribes for defense.

name: Fijian War Club
description: A heavy club with a stone head, used by Fijian warriors in traditional combat.

name: Tapa Cloth Sword
description: A ceremonial sword made from tapa cloth and bamboo, symbolizing peace and diplomacy.

name: Bamboo Spear
description: A lightweight spear made from bamboo, often tipped with shark teeth for hunting.

name: Tongan Fighting Staff
description: A long wooden staff used in traditional Tongan martial arts, often decorated with intricate carvings.

name: Hawaiian War Club
description: A traditional Hawaiian club made from Koa wood, used in ancient warfare and ceremonies.
